Docs.summary: Represents an object that monitors changes to files.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The FileChangeMonitor class is a base <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor> type for classes that monitor changes to files. To create a monitor for changes in the file system, you can inherit from this class.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a cache item that uses a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor> object to monitor the state of the source data (a file) on the file system. The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor> class inherits from the FileChangeMonitor class. The cache entry is defined using a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy> object that provides eviction and expiration details for the cache entry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection is typically set in the constructor of a derived <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.FileChangeMonitor> type.
To provide custom file-change monitoring, you must override this method in a derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the last time that a file that is being monitored was changed.
Docs.value: If multiple files are monitored, the last modified time of the most recently modified file; otherwise, the last time that the file that is being monitored was changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the LastModified property is typically calculated during the initialization phase of a derived class.
To provide custom file change monitoring, you must override this method in a derived class.
